channel.title: Ham Radio Duo
channel.description: CW and POTA. Adventure couple doing amateur radio, ham radio, CW, morse code, and POTA parks on the air.

item.title: Print Your Own Case for The Just OK Mini

item.title: The Contraption - 3D Files Available for the Preview Version
item.description: The Contraption is a 3D printed case for creating a handheld HF radio out of a QRP radio + battery + antenna. It is ridiculous, but fun. With the Contraption, you can turn your QMX or QCX-mini (and someday CFT1) into a handheld portable HF 20m radio. For morse code, you can use a magnetic key mounte

item.title: KX2 vs Budget CW RIGs
item.description: We took an Elecraft KX2 into the field and put it up against three less expensive CW rigs. Was the KX2 worth ten times the price? We ran POTA activations, ragchews, and side-by-side tests to find out. Spoiler: it was fun and there is something to love about all the radios. What we tested We used the

item.title: New ultra-portable 20m antenna: pre-order
item.description: We designed a pocket sized, ridiculously small antenna for the 20 meter band in amateur radio. item.title: Hamfest Preview: Radio Museum!
item.description: Explore the Signals Museum in Huntsville This week we had the honor to meet and interview Dr. Marc Bendickson who is the collector behind the new Signals Museum in Huntsville, AL. item.title: Duo Straight Key ONE!! Order your new Morse Code key now.
item.description: Meet our latest creation: the Duo Straight Key ONE. We love straight keys. We recently restored a WWII-era J-38 and absolutely fell in love with the way that it felt. The long lever arm action provides a very smooth punchy feel as the letters just pop out. We wished we could tell everyone to go to t

item.title: Wasps and POTA?
item.description: CW POTA Activation by the Lake at Joe Wheeler State Park We love camping and hiking, and this is a great place for both. item.title: Hunting POTA with a 2 ft Antenna!
item.description: We recently did a there-and-back trip to get our daughter from college in Florida. We made an adventure out of it, by playing radio pretty much the whole trip! It was a great excuse to stress test a new antenna we are working on, the "Just OK Antenna". We're hoping to sort out some things and eventu

item.title: A Piece of Morse Code History!

item.title: How is your fist?
item.description: CW Morse Code Checker Tool Of course we don't mean how is your literal fist, but how is your CW fist? Becky recently got a new Vibroplex Bug from the '60s. item.title: Introducing some Boy Scouts to Morse Code and Parks On The Air (POTA)
item.description: Monte Sano State Park: A Perfect Spot Monte Sano State Park in Alabama is a beautiful place and a great location to find a new spot for our latest POTA activation. item.title: Seconds to Deploy Challenge
item.description: Hey there, radio friends! Welcome to our "Seconds to Deploy Challenge!" Imagine a race where the only way to win is to have the quickest deploy.
